9 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10 // qs_parse (modified)
11 // https://github.com/bartgrantham/qs_parse
12 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13 /* Similar to strncmp, but handles URL-encoding for either string */
14 int qs_strncmp(const char * s, const char * qs, size_t n);
15 
16 
17 /* Finds the beginning of each key/value pair and stores a pointer in qs_kv.
18  * Also decodes the value portion of the k/v pair *in-place*. In a future
19  * enhancement it will also have a compile-time option of sorting qs_kv
20  * alphabetically by key. */
21 int qs_parse(char * qs, char * qs_kv[], int qs_kv_size);
22 
23 
24 /* Used by qs_parse to decode the value portion of a k/v pair */
25 int qs_decode(char * qs);
26 
27 
28 /* Looks up the value according to the key on a pre-processed query string
29  * A future enhancement will be a compile-time option to look up the key
30  * in a pre-sorted qs_kv array via a binary search. */
31 //char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * qs_kv[], int qs_kv_size);
32  char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * const * qs_kv, int qs_kv_size, int nth);
33 
34 
35 /* Non-destructive lookup of value, based on key. User provides the
36  * destinaton string and length. */
37 char * qs_scanvalue(const char * key, const char * qs, char * val, size_t val_len);
38 
39 // TODO: implement sorting of the qs_kv array; for now ensure it's not compiled
40 #undef _qsSORTING
41 
42 // isxdigit _is_ available in <ctype.h>, but let's avoid another header instead
43 #define CROW_QS_ISHEX(x) ((((x)>='0'&&(x)<='9') || ((x)>='A'&&(x)<='F') || ((x)>='a'&&(x)<='f')) ? 1 : 0)
44 #define CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(x) (((x)>='0'&&(x)<='9') ? (x)-48 : ((x)>='A'&&(x)<='F') ? (x)-55 : ((x)>='a'&&(x)<='f') ? (x)-87 : 0)
45 #define CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(x) ((((x)=='=')||((x)=='#')||((x)=='&')||((x)=='\0')) ? 0 : 1)
46 
47 inline int qs_strncmp(const char * s, const char * qs, size_t n)
48 {
49  int i=0;
50  unsigned char u1, u2, unyb, lnyb;
51 
52  while(n-- > 0)
53  {
54  u1 = (unsigned char) *s++;
55  u2 = (unsigned char) *qs++;
56 
57  if ( ! CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(u1) ) { u1 = '\0'; }
58  if ( ! CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(u2) ) { u2 = '\0'; }
59 
60  if ( u1 == '+' ) { u1 = ' '; }
61  if ( u1 == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
62  {
63  unyb = (unsigned char) *s++;
64  lnyb = (unsigned char) *s++;
65  if ( CROW_QS_ISHEX(unyb) && CROW_QS_ISHEX(lnyb) )
66  u1 = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(unyb) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(lnyb);
67  else
68  u1 = '\0';
69  }
70 
71  if ( u2 == '+' ) { u2 = ' '; }
72  if ( u2 == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
73  {
74  unyb = (unsigned char) *qs++;
75  lnyb = (unsigned char) *qs++;
76  if ( CROW_QS_ISHEX(unyb) && CROW_QS_ISHEX(lnyb) )
77  u2 = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(unyb) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(lnyb);
78  else
79  u2 = '\0';
80  }
81 
82  if ( u1 != u2 )
83  return u1 - u2;
84  if ( u1 == '\0' )
85  return 0;
86  i++;
87  }
88  if ( CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(*qs) )
89  return -1;
90  else
91  return 0;
92 }
93 
94 
95 inline int qs_parse(char * qs, char * qs_kv[], int qs_kv_size)
96 {
97  int i, j;
98  char * substr_ptr;
99 
100  for(i=0; i<qs_kv_size; i++) qs_kv[i] = NULL;
101 
102  // find the beginning of the k/v substrings or the fragment
103  substr_ptr = qs + strcspn(qs, "?#");
104  if (substr_ptr[0] != '\0')
105  substr_ptr++;
106  else
107  return 0; // no query or fragment
108 
109  i=0;
110  while(i<qs_kv_size)
111  {
112  qs_kv[i] = substr_ptr;
113  j = strcspn(substr_ptr, "&");
114  if ( substr_ptr[j] == '\0' ) { break; }
115  substr_ptr += j + 1;
116  i++;
117  }
118  i++; // x &'s -> means x iterations of this loop -> means *x+1* k/v pairs
119 
120  // we only decode the values in place, the keys could have '='s in them
121  // which will hose our ability to distinguish keys from values later
122  for(j=0; j<i; j++)
123  {
124  substr_ptr = qs_kv[j] + strcspn(qs_kv[j], "=&#");
125  if ( substr_ptr[0] == '&' || substr_ptr[0] == '\0') // blank value: skip decoding
126  substr_ptr[0] = '\0';
127  else
128  qs_decode(++substr_ptr);
129  }
130 
131 #ifdef _qsSORTING
132 // TODO: qsort qs_kv, using qs_strncmp() for the comparison
133 #endif
134 
135  return i;
136 }
137 
138 
139 inline int qs_decode(char * qs)
140 {
141  int i=0, j=0;
142 
143  while( CROW_QS_ISQSCHR(qs[j]) )
144  {
145  if ( qs[j] == '+' ) { qs[i] = ' '; }
146  else if ( qs[j] == '%' ) // easier/safer than scanf
147  {
148  if ( ! CROW_QS_ISHEX(qs[j+1]) || ! CROW_QS_ISHEX(qs[j+2]) )
149  {
150  qs[i] = '\0';
151  return i;
152  }
153  qs[i] = (CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(qs[j+1]) * 16) + CROW_QS_HEX2DEC(qs[j+2]);
154  j+=2;
155  }
156  else
157  {
158  qs[i] = qs[j];
159  }
160  i++; j++;
161  }
162  qs[i] = '\0';
163 
164  return i;
165 }
166 
167 
168 inline char * qs_k2v(const char * key, char * const * qs_kv, int qs_kv_size, int nth = 0)
169 {
170  int i;
171  size_t key_len, skip;
172 
173  key_len = strlen(key);
174 
175 #ifdef _qsSORTING
176 // TODO: binary search for key in the sorted qs_kv
177 #else // _qsSORTING
178  for(i=0; i<qs_kv_size; i++)
179  {
180  // we rely on the unambiguous '=' to find the value in our k/v pair
181  if ( qs_strncmp(key, qs_kv[i], key_len) == 0 )
182  {
183  skip = strcspn(qs_kv[i], "=");
184  if ( qs_kv[i][skip] == '=' )
185  skip++;
186  // return (zero-char value) ? ptr to trailing '\0' : ptr to value
187  if(nth == 0)
188  return qs_kv[i] + skip;
189  else
190  --nth;
191  }
192  }
193 #endif // _qsSORTING
194 
195  return NULL;
196 }
197 
198 
199 inline char * qs_scanvalue(const char * key, const char * qs, char * val, size_t val_len)
200 {
201  size_t i, key_len;
202  const char * tmp;
203 
204  // find the beginning of the k/v substrings
205  if ( (tmp = strchr(qs, '?')) != NULL )
206  qs = tmp + 1;
207 
208  key_len = strlen(key);
209  while(qs[0] != '#' && qs[0] != '\0')
210  {
211  if ( qs_strncmp(key, qs, key_len) == 0 )
212  break;
213  qs += strcspn(qs, "&") + 1;
214  }
215 
216  if ( qs[0] == '\0' ) return NULL;
217 
218  qs += strcspn(qs, "=&#");
219  if ( qs[0] == '=' )
220  {
221  qs++;
222  i = strcspn(qs, "&=#");
223  strncpy(val, qs, (val_len-1)<(i+1) ? (val_len-1) : (i+1));
224  qs_decode(val);
225  }
226  else
227  {
228  if ( val_len > 0 )
229  val[0] = '\0';
230  }
231 
232  return val;
233 }
234 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
235 
236 
237 namespace crow
238 {
239  class query_string
240  {
241  public:
242  static const int MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT = 256;
243 
244  query_string()
245  {
246 
247  }
248 
249  query_string(const query_string& qs)
250  : url_(qs.url_)
251  {
252  for(auto p:qs.key_value_pairs_)
253  {
254  key_value_pairs_.push_back((char*)(p-qs.url_.c_str()+url_.c_str()));
255  }
256  }
257 
258  query_string& operator = (const query_string& qs)
259  {
260  url_ = qs.url_;
261  key_value_pairs_.clear();
262  for(auto p:qs.key_value_pairs_)
263  {
264  key_value_pairs_.push_back((char*)(p-qs.url_.c_str()+url_.c_str()));
265  }
266  return *this;
267  }
268 
269  query_string& operator = (query_string&& qs)
270  {
271  key_value_pairs_ = std::move(qs.key_value_pairs_);
272  char* old_data = (char*)qs.url_.c_str();
273  url_ = std::move(qs.url_);
274  for(auto& p:key_value_pairs_)
275  {
276  p += (char*)url_.c_str() - old_data;
277  }
278  return *this;
279  }
280 
281 
282  query_string(std::string url)
283  : url_(std::move(url))
284  {
285  if (url_.empty())
286  return;
287 
288  key_value_pairs_.resize(MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT);
289 
290  int count = qs_parse(&url_[0], &key_value_pairs_[0], MAX_KEY_VALUE_PAIRS_COUNT);
291  key_value_pairs_.resize(count);
292  }
293 
294  void clear()
295  {
296  key_value_pairs_.clear();
297  url_.clear();
298  }
299 
300  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const query_string& qs)
301  {
302  os << "[ ";
303  for(size_t i = 0; i < qs.key_value_pairs_.size(); ++i) {
304  if (i)
305  os << ", ";
306  os << qs.key_value_pairs_[i];
307  }
308  os << " ]";
309  return os;
310 
311  }
312 
313  char* get (const std::string& name) const
314  {
315  char* ret = qs_k2v(name.c_str(), key_value_pairs_.data(), key_value_pairs_.size());
316  return ret;
317  }
318 
319  std::vector<char*> get_list (const std::string& name) const
320  {
321  std::vector<char*> ret;
322  std::string plus = name + "[]";
323  char* element = nullptr;
324 
325  int count = 0;
326  while(1)
327  {
328  element = qs_k2v(plus.c_str(), key_value_pairs_.data(), key_value_pairs_.size(), count++);
329  if (!element)
330  break;
331  ret.push_back(element);
332  }
333  return ret;
334  }
335 
336 
337  private:
338  std::string url_;
339  std::vector<char*> key_value_pairs_;
340  };
341 
342 } // end namespace

361 #define crow_json_likely(x) __builtin_expect(x, 1)
362 #define crow_json_unlikely(x) __builtin_expect(x, 0)
363 #else

375 
376  namespace json
377  {
378  inline void escape(const std::string& str, std::string& ret)
379  {
380  ret.reserve(ret.size() + str.size()+str.size()/4);
381  for(char c:str)
382  {
383  switch(c)
384  {
385  case '"': ret += "\\\""; break;
386  case '\\': ret += "\\\\"; break;
387  case '\n': ret += "\\n"; break;
388  case '\b': ret += "\\b"; break;
389  case '\f': ret += "\\f"; break;
390  case '\r': ret += "\\r"; break;
391  case '\t': ret += "\\t"; break;
392  default:
393  if (0 <= c && c < 0x20)
394  {
395  ret += "\\u00";
396  auto to_hex = [](char c)
397  {
398  c = c&0xf;
399  if (c < 10)
400  return '0' + c;
401  return 'a'+c-10;
402  };
403  ret += to_hex(c/16);
404  ret += to_hex(c%16);
405  }
406  else
407  ret += c;
408  break;
409  }
410  }
411  }
412  inline std::string escape(const std::string& str)
413  {
414  std::string ret;
415  escape(str, ret);
416  return ret;
417  }
418 
419  enum class type : char
420  {
421  Null,
422  False,
423  True,
424  Number,
425  String,
426  List,
427  Object,
428  };
429 
430  inline const char* get_type_str(type t) {
431  switch(t){
432  case type::Number: return "Number";
433  case type::False: return "False";
434  case type::True: return "True";
435  case type::List: return "List";
436  case type::String: return "String";
437  case type::Object: return "Object";
438  default: return "Unknown";
439  }
440  };
441 
442  class rvalue;
443  rvalue load(const char* data, size_t size);
444 
445  namespace detail
446  {
447 
448  struct r_string
449  : boost::less_than_comparable<r_string>,
450  boost::less_than_comparable<r_string, std::string>,
451  boost::equality_comparable<r_string>,
452  boost::equality_comparable<r_string, std::string>
453  {
454  r_string() {};
455  r_string(char* s, char* e)
456  : s_(s), e_(e)
457  {};
458  ~r_string()
459  {
460  if (owned_)
461  delete[] s_;
462  }
463 
464  r_string(const r_string& r)
465  {
466  *this = r;
467  }
468 
469  r_string(r_string&& r)
470  {
471  *this = r;
472  }
473 
474  r_string& operator = (r_string&& r)
475  {
476  s_ = r.s_;
477  e_ = r.e_;
478  owned_ = r.owned_;
479  return *this;
480  }
481 
482  r_string& operator = (const r_string& r)
483  {
484  s_ = r.s_;
485  e_ = r.e_;
486  owned_ = 0;
487  return *this;
488  }
489 
490  operator std::string () const
491  {
492  return std::string(s_, e_);
493  }
494 
495 
496  const char* begin() const { return s_; }
497  const char* end() const { return e_; }
498  size_t size() const { return end() - begin(); }
499 
500  using iterator = const char*;
501  using const_iterator = const char*;
502 
503  char* s_;
504  mutable char* e_;
505  uint8_t owned_{0};
506  friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& os, const r_string& s)
507  {
508  os << (std::string)s;
509  return os;
510  }
511  private:
512  void force(char* s, uint32_t length)
513  {
514  s_ = s;
515  owned_ = 1;
516  }
517  friend rvalue crow::json::load(const char* data, size_t size);
518  };
519 
520  inline bool operator < (const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
521  {
522  return boost::lexicographical_compare(l,r);
523  }
524 
525  inline bool operator < (const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
526  {
527  return boost::lexicographical_compare(l,r);
528  }
529 
530  inline bool operator > (const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
531  {
532  return boost::lexicographical_compare(r,l);
533  }
534 
535  inline bool operator == (const r_string& l, const r_string& r)
536  {
537  return boost::equals(l,r);
538  }
539 
540  inline bool operator == (const r_string& l, const std::string& r)
541  {
542  return boost::equals(l,r);
543  }
544  }
545 
546  class rvalue
547  {
548  static const int cached_bit = 2;
549  static const int error_bit = 4;
550  public:
551  rvalue() noexcept : option_{error_bit}
552  {}
553  rvalue(type t) noexcept
554  : lsize_{}, lremain_{}, t_{t}
555  {}
556  rvalue(type t, char* s, char* e) noexcept
557  : start_{s},
558  end_{e},
559  t_{t}
560  {}
561 
562  rvalue(const rvalue& r)
563  : start_(r.start_),
564  end_(r.end_),
565  key_(r.key_),
566  t_(r.t_),
567  option_(r.option_)
568  {
569  copy_l(r);
570  }
571 
572  rvalue(rvalue&& r) noexcept
573  {
574  *this = std::move(r);
575  }
576 
577  rvalue& operator = (const rvalue& r)
578  {
579  start_ = r.start_;
580  end_ = r.end_;
581  key_ = r.key_;
582  copy_l(r);
583  t_ = r.t_;
584  option_ = r.option_;
585  return *this;
586  }
587  rvalue& operator = (rvalue&& r) noexcept
588  {
589  start_ = r.start_;
590  end_ = r.end_;
591  key_ = std::move(r.key_);
592  l_ = std::move(r.l_);
593  lsize_ = r.lsize_;
594  lremain_ = r.lremain_;
595  t_ = r.t_;
596  option_ = r.option_;
597  return *this;
598  }
599 
600  explicit operator bool() const noexcept
601  {
602  return (option_ & error_bit) == 0;
603  }
604 
605  explicit operator int64_t() const
606  {
607  return i();
608  }
609 
610  explicit operator int() const
611  {
612  return (int)i();
613  }
614 
615  type t() const
616  {
617 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
618  if (option_ & error_bit)
619  {
620  throw std::runtime_error("invalid json object");
621  }
622 #endif
623  return t_;
624  }
625 
626  int64_t i() const
627  {
628 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
629  switch (t()) {
630  case type::Number:
631  case type::String:
632  return boost::lexical_cast<int64_t>(start_, end_-start_);
633  default:
634  const std::string msg = "expected number, got: "
635  + std::string(get_type_str(t()));
636  throw std::runtime_error(msg);
637  }
638 #endif
639  return boost::lexical_cast<int64_t>(start_, end_-start_);
640  }
641 
642  double d() const
643  {
644 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
645  if (t() != type::Number)
646  throw std::runtime_error("value is not number");
647 #endif
648  return boost::lexical_cast<double>(start_, end_-start_);
649  }
650 
651  bool b() const
652  {
653 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
654  if (t() != type::True && t() != type::False)
655  throw std::runtime_error("value is not boolean");
656 #endif
657  return t() == type::True;
658  }
659 
660  void unescape() const
661  {
662  if (*(start_-1))
663  {
664  char* head = start_;
665  char* tail = start_;
666  while(head != end_)
667  {
668  if (*head == '\\')
669  {
670  switch(*++head)
671  {
672  case '"': *tail++ = '"'; break;
673  case '\\': *tail++ = '\\'; break;
674  case '/': *tail++ = '/'; break;
675  case 'b': *tail++ = '\b'; break;
676  case 'f': *tail++ = '\f'; break;
677  case 'n': *tail++ = '\n'; break;
678  case 'r': *tail++ = '\r'; break;
679  case 't': *tail++ = '\t'; break;
680  case 'u':
681  {
682  auto from_hex = [](char c)
683  {
684  if (c >= 'a')
685  return c - 'a' + 10;
686  if (c >= 'A')
687  return c - 'A' + 10;
688  return c - '0';
689  };
690  unsigned int code =
691  (from_hex(head[1])<<12) +
692  (from_hex(head[2])<< 8) +
693  (from_hex(head[3])<< 4) +
694  from_hex(head[4]);
695  if (code >= 0x800)
696  {
697  *tail++ = 0xE0 | (code >> 12);
698  *tail++ = 0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3F);
699  *tail++ = 0x80 | (code & 0x3F);
700  }
701  else if (code >= 0x80)
702  {
703  *tail++ = 0xC0 | (code >> 6);
704  *tail++ = 0x80 | (code & 0x3F);
705  }
706  else
707  {
708  *tail++ = code;
709  }
710  head += 4;
711  }
712  break;
713  }
714  }
715  else
716  *tail++ = *head;
717  head++;
718  }
719  end_ = tail;
720  *end_ = 0;
721  *(start_-1) = 0;
722  }
723  }
724 
725  detail::r_string s() const
726  {
727 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
728  if (t() != type::String)
729  throw std::runtime_error("value is not string");
730 #endif
731  unescape();
732  return detail::r_string{start_, end_};
733  }
734 
735  bool has(const char* str) const
736  {
737  return has(std::string(str));
738  }
739 
740  bool has(const std::string& str) const
741  {
742  struct Pred
743  {
744  bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const rvalue& r) const
745  {
746  return l.key_ < r.key_;
747  };
748  bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r) const
749  {
750  return l.key_ < r;
751  };
752  bool operator()(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r) const
753  {
754  return l < r.key_;
755  };
756  };
757  if (!is_cached())
758  {
759  std::sort(begin(), end(), Pred());
760  set_cached();
761  }
762  auto it = lower_bound(begin(), end(), str, Pred());
763  return it != end() && it->key_ == str;
764  }
765 
766  int count(const std::string& str)
767  {
768  return has(str) ? 1 : 0;
769  }
770 
771  rvalue* begin() const
772  {
773 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
774  if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
775  throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
776 #endif
777  return l_.get();
778  }
779  rvalue* end() const
780  {
781 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
782  if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
783  throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
784 #endif
785  return l_.get()+lsize_;
786  }
787 
788  const detail::r_string& key() const
789  {
790  return key_;
791  }
792 
793  size_t size() const
794  {
795  if (t() == type::String)
796  return s().size();
797 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
798  if (t() != type::Object && t() != type::List)
799  throw std::runtime_error("value is not a container");
800 #endif
801  return lsize_;
802  }
803 
804  const rvalue& operator[](int index) const
805  {
806 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
807  if (t() != type::List)
808  throw std::runtime_error("value is not a list");
809  if (index >= (int)lsize_ || index < 0)
810  throw std::runtime_error("list out of bound");
811 #endif
812  return l_[index];
813  }
814 
815  const rvalue& operator[](size_t index) const
816  {
817 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
818  if (t() != type::List)
819  throw std::runtime_error("value is not a list");
820  if (index >= lsize_)
821  throw std::runtime_error("list out of bound");
822 #endif
823  return l_[index];
824  }
825 
826  const rvalue& operator[](const char* str) const
827  {
828  return this->operator[](std::string(str));
829  }
830 
831  const rvalue& operator[](const std::string& str) const
832  {
833 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
834  if (t() != type::Object)
835  throw std::runtime_error("value is not an object");
836 #endif
837  struct Pred
838  {
839  bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const rvalue& r) const
840  {
841  return l.key_ < r.key_;
842  };
843  bool operator()(const rvalue& l, const std::string& r) const
844  {
845  return l.key_ < r;
846  };
847  bool operator()(const std::string& l, const rvalue& r) const
848  {
849  return l < r.key_;
850  };
851  };
852  if (!is_cached())
853  {
854  std::sort(begin(), end(), Pred());
855  set_cached();
856  }
857  auto it = lower_bound(begin(), end(), str, Pred());
858  if (it != end() && it->key_ == str)
859  return *it;
860 #ifndef CROW_JSON_NO_ERROR_CHECK
861  throw std::runtime_error("cannot find key");
862 #else
863  static rvalue nullValue;
864  return nullValue;
865 #endif
866  }
867 
868  void set_error()
869  {
870  option_|=error_bit;
871  }
872 
873  bool error() const
874  {
875  return (option_&error_bit)!=0;
876  }
877  private:
878  bool is_cached() const
879  {
880  return (option_&cached_bit)!=0;
881  }
882  void set_cached() const
883  {
884  option_ |= cached_bit;
885  }
886  void copy_l(const rvalue& r)
887  {
888  if (r.t() != type::Object && r.t() != type::List)
889  return;
890  lsize_ = r.lsize_;
891  lremain_ = 0;
892  l_.reset(new rvalue[lsize_]);
893  std::copy(r.begin(), r.end(), begin());
894  }
895 
896  void emplace_back(rvalue&& v)
897  {
898  if (!lremain_)
899  {
900  int new_size = lsize_ + lsize_;
901  if (new_size - lsize_ > 60000)
902  new_size = lsize_ + 60000;
903  if (new_size < 4)
904  new_size = 4;
905  rvalue* p = new rvalue[new_size];
906  rvalue* p2 = p;
907  for(auto& x : *this)
908  *p2++ = std::move(x);
909  l_.reset(p);
910  lremain_ = new_size - lsize_;
911  }
912  l_[lsize_++] = std::move(v);
913  lremain_ --;
914  }
915 
916  mutable char* start_;
917  mutable char* end_;
918  detail::r_string key_;
919  std::unique_ptr<rvalue[]> l_;
920  uint32_t lsize_;
921  uint16_t lremain_;
922  type t_;
923  mutable uint8_t option_{0};
924 
925  friend rvalue load_nocopy_internal(char* data, size_t size);
926  friend rvalue load(const char* data, size_t size);
927  friend std::ostream& operator <<(std::ostream& os, const rvalue& r)
928  {
929  switch(r.t_)
930  {
931 
932  case type::Null: os << "null"; break;
933  case type::False: os << "false"; break;
934  case type::True: os << "true"; break;
935  case type::Number: os << r.d(); break;
936  case type::String: os << '"' << r.s() << '"'; break;
937  case type::List:
938  {
939  os << '[';
940  bool first = true;
941  for(auto& x : r)
942  {
943  if (!first)
944  os << ',';
945  first = false;
946  os << x;
947  }
948  os << ']';
949  }
950  break;
951  case type::Object:
952  {
953  os << '{';
954  bool first = true;
955  for(auto& x : r)
956  {
957  if (!first)
958  os << ',';
959  os << '"' << escape(x.key_) << "\":";
960  first = false;
961  os << x;
962  }
963  os << '}';
964  }
965  break;
966  }
967  return os;
968  }
969  };
970  namespace detail {
971  }
972 
973  inline bool operator == (const rvalue& l, const std::string& r)
974  {
975  return l.s() == r;
976  }
977 
978  inline bool operator == (const std::string& l, const rvalue& r)
979  {
980  return l == r.s();
981  }
982 
983  inline bool operator != (const rvalue& l, const std::string& r)
984  {
985  return l.s() != r;
986  }
987 
988  inline bool operator != (const std::string& l, const rvalue& r)
989  {
990  return l != r.s();
991  }
992 
993  inline bool operator == (const rvalue& l, double r)
994  {
995  return l.d() == r;
996  }
997 
998  inline bool operator == (double l, const rvalue& r)
999  {
1000  return l == r.d();
1001  }
1002 
1003  inline bool operator != (const rvalue& l, double r)
1004  {
1005  return l.d() != r;
1006  }
1007 
1008  inline bool operator != (double l, const rvalue& r)
1009  {
1010  return l != r.d();
1011  }
1012 
1013 
1014  inline rvalue load_nocopy_internal(char* data, size_t size)
1015  {
1016  //static const char* escaped = "\"\\/\b\f\n\r\t";
1017  struct Parser
1018  {
1019  Parser(char* data, size_t size)
1020  : data(data)
1021  {
1022  }
1023 
1024  bool consume(char c)
1025  {
1026  if (crow_json_unlikely(*data != c))
1027  return false;
1028  data++;
1029  return true;
1030  }
1031 
1032  void ws_skip()
1033  {
1034  while(*data == ' ' || *data == '\t' || *data == '\r' || *data == '\n') ++data;
1035  };
1036 
1037  rvalue decode_string()
1038  {
1039  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume('"')))
1040  return {};
1041  char* start = data;
1042  uint8_t has_escaping = 0;
1043  while(1)
1044  {
1045  if (crow_json_likely(*data != '"' && *data != '\\' && *data != '\0'))
1046  {
1047  data ++;
1048  }
1049  else if (*data == '"')
1050  {
1051  *data = 0;
1052  *(start-1) = has_escaping;
1053  data++;
1054  return {type::String, start, data-1};
1055  }
1056  else if (*data == '\\')
1057  {
1058  has_escaping = 1;
1059  data++;
1060  switch(*data)
1061  {
1062  case 'u':
1063  {
1064  auto check = [](char c)
1065  {
1066  return
1067  ('0' <= c && c <= '9') ||
1068  ('a' <= c && c <= 'f') ||
1069  ('A' <= c && c <= 'F');
1070  };
1071  if (!(check(*(data+1)) &&
1072  check(*(data+2)) &&
1073  check(*(data+3)) &&
1074  check(*(data+4))))
1075  return {};
1076  }
1077  data += 5;
1078  break;
1079  case '"':
1080  case '\\':
1081  case '/':
1082  case 'b':
1083  case 'f':
1084  case 'n':
1085  case 'r':
1086  case 't':
1087  data ++;
1088  break;
1089  default:
1090  return {};
1091  }
1092  }
1093  else
1094  return {};
1095  }
1096  return {};
1097  }
1098 
1099  rvalue decode_list()
1100  {
1101  rvalue ret(type::List);
1102  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume('[')))
1103  {
1104  ret.set_error();
1105  return ret;
1106  }
1107  ws_skip();
1108  if (crow_json_unlikely(*data == ']'))
1109  {
1110  data++;
1111  return ret;
1112  }
1113 
1114  while(1)
1115  {
1116  auto v = decode_value();
1117  if (crow_json_unlikely(!v))
1118  {
1119  ret.set_error();
1120  break;
1121  }
1122  ws_skip();
1123  ret.emplace_back(std::move(v));
1124  if (*data == ']')
1125  {
1126  data++;
1127  break;
1128  }
1129  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume(',')))
1130  {
1131  ret.set_error();
1132  break;
1133  }
1134  ws_skip();
1135  }
1136  return ret;
1137  }
1138 
1139  rvalue decode_number()
1140  {
1141  char* start = data;
1142 
1143  enum NumberParsingState
1144  {
1145  Minus,
1146  AfterMinus,
1147  ZeroFirst,
1148  Digits,
1149  DigitsAfterPoints,
1150  E,
1151  DigitsAfterE,
1152  Invalid,
1153  } state{Minus};
1154  while(crow_json_likely(state != Invalid))
1155  {
1156  switch(*data)
1157  {
1158  case '0':
1159  state = (NumberParsingState)"\2\2\7\3\4\6\6"[state];
1160  /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Minus || state == NumberParsingState::AfterMinus)
1161  {
1162  state = NumberParsingState::ZeroFirst;
1163  }
1164  else if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
1165  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE ||
1166  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints)
1167  {
1168  // ok; pass
1169  }
1170  else if (state == NumberParsingState::E)
1171  {
1172  state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE;
1173  }
1174  else
1175  return {};*/
1176  break;
1177  case '1': case '2': case '3':
1178  case '4': case '5': case '6':
1179  case '7': case '8': case '9':
1180  state = (NumberParsingState)"\3\3\7\3\4\6\6"[state];
1181  while(*(data+1) >= '0' && *(data+1) <= '9') data++;
1182  /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Minus || state == NumberParsingState::AfterMinus)
1183  {
1184  state = NumberParsingState::Digits;
1185  }
1186  else if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
1187  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE ||
1188  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints)
1189  {
1190  // ok; pass
1191  }
1192  else if (state == NumberParsingState::E)
1193  {
1194  state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE;
1195  }
1196  else
1197  return {};*/
1198  break;
1199  case '.':
1200  state = (NumberParsingState)"\7\7\4\4\7\7\7"[state];
1201  /*
1202  if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits || state == NumberParsingState::ZeroFirst)
1203  {
1204  state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints;
1205  }
1206  else
1207  return {};
1208  */
1209  break;
1210  case '-':
1211  state = (NumberParsingState)"\1\7\7\7\7\6\7"[state];
1212  /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Minus)
1213  {
1214  state = NumberParsingState::AfterMinus;
1215  }
1216  else if (state == NumberParsingState::E)
1217  {
1218  state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE;
1219  }
1220  else
1221  return {};*/
1222  break;
1223  case '+':
1224  state = (NumberParsingState)"\7\7\7\7\7\6\7"[state];
1225  /*if (state == NumberParsingState::E)
1226  {
1227  state = NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE;
1228  }
1229  else
1230  return {};*/
1231  break;
1232  case 'e': case 'E':
1233  state = (NumberParsingState)"\7\7\7\5\5\7\7"[state];
1234  /*if (state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
1235  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints)
1236  {
1237  state = NumberParsingState::E;
1238  }
1239  else
1240  return {};*/
1241  break;
1242  default:
1243  if (crow_json_likely(state == NumberParsingState::ZeroFirst ||
1244  state == NumberParsingState::Digits ||
1245  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterPoints ||
1246  state == NumberParsingState::DigitsAfterE))
1247  return {type::Number, start, data};
1248  else
1249  return {};
1250  }
1251  data++;
1252  }
1253 
1254  return {};
1255  }
1256 
1257  rvalue decode_value()
1258  {
1259  switch(*data)
1260  {
1261  case '[':
1262  return decode_list();
1263  case '{':
1264  return decode_object();
1265  case '"':
1266  return decode_string();
1267  case 't':
1268  if (//e-data >= 4 &&
1269  data[1] == 'r' &&
1270  data[2] == 'u' &&
1271  data[3] == 'e')
1272  {
1273  data += 4;
1274  return {type::True};
1275  }
1276  else
1277  return {};
1278  case 'f':
1279  if (//e-data >= 5 &&
1280  data[1] == 'a' &&
1281  data[2] == 'l' &&
1282  data[3] == 's' &&
1283  data[4] == 'e')
1284  {
1285  data += 5;
1286  return {type::False};
1287  }
1288  else
1289  return {};
1290  case 'n':
1291  if (//e-data >= 4 &&
1292  data[1] == 'u' &&
1293  data[2] == 'l' &&
1294  data[3] == 'l')
1295  {
1296  data += 4;
1297  return {type::Null};
1298  }
1299  else
1300  return {};
1301  //case '1': case '2': case '3':
1302  //case '4': case '5': case '6':
1303  //case '7': case '8': case '9':
1304  //case '0': case '-':
1305  default:
1306  return decode_number();
1307  }
1308  return {};
1309  }
1310 
1311  rvalue decode_object()
1312  {
1313  rvalue ret(type::Object);
1314  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume('{')))
1315  {
1316  ret.set_error();
1317  return ret;
1318  }
1319 
1320  ws_skip();
1321 
1322  if (crow_json_unlikely(*data == '}'))
1323  {
1324  data++;
1325  return ret;
1326  }
1327 
1328  while(1)
1329  {
1330  auto t = decode_string();
1331  if (crow_json_unlikely(!t))
1332  {
1333  ret.set_error();
1334  break;
1335  }
1336 
1337  ws_skip();
1338  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume(':')))
1339  {
1340  ret.set_error();
1341  break;
1342  }
1343 
1344  // TODO caching key to speed up (flyweight?)
1345  auto key = t.s();
1346 
1347  ws_skip();
1348  auto v = decode_value();
1349  if (crow_json_unlikely(!v))
1350  {
1351  ret.set_error();
1352  break;
1353  }
1354  ws_skip();
1355 
1356  v.key_ = std::move(key);
1357  ret.emplace_back(std::move(v));
1358  if (crow_json_unlikely(*data == '}'))
1359  {
1360  data++;
1361  break;
1362  }
1363  if (crow_json_unlikely(!consume(',')))
1364  {
1365  ret.set_error();
1366  break;
1367  }
1368  ws_skip();
1369  }
1370  return ret;
1371  }
1372 
1373  rvalue parse()
1374  {
1375  ws_skip();
1376  auto ret = decode_value(); // or decode object?
1377  ws_skip();
1378  if (ret && *data != '\0')
1379  ret.set_error();
1380  return ret;
1381  }
1382 
1383  char* data;
1384  };
1385  return Parser(data, size).parse();
1386  }
1387  inline rvalue load(const char* data, size_t size)
1388  {
1389  char* s = new char[size+1];
1390  memcpy(s, data, size);
1391  s[size] = 0;
1392  auto ret = load_nocopy_internal(s, size);
1393  if (ret)
1394  ret.key_.force(s, size);
1395  else
1396  delete[] s;
1397  return ret;
1398  }
1399 
1400  inline rvalue load(const char* data)
1401  {
1402  return load(data, strlen(data));
1403  }
1404 
1405  inline rvalue load(const std::string& str)
1406  {
1407  return load(str.data(), str.size());
1408  }
1409 
1410  class wvalue
1411  {
1412  friend class crow::mustache::template_t;
1413  public:
1414  type t() const { return t_; }
1415  private:
1416  type t_{type::Null};
1417  double d {};
1418  std::string s;
1419  std::unique_ptr<std::vector<wvalue>> l;
1420  std::unique_ptr<std::unordered_map<std::string, wvalue>> o;
1421  public:
1422 
1423  wvalue() {}
1424 
1425  wvalue(const rvalue& r)
1426  {
1427  t_ = r.t();
1428  switch(r.t())
1429  {
1430  case type::Null:
1431  case type::False:
1432  case type::True:
1433  return;
1434  case type::Number:
1435  d = r.d();
1436  return;
1437  case type::String:
1438  s = r.s();
1439  return;
1440  case type::List:
1441  l = std::move(std::unique_ptr<std::vector<wvalue>>(new std::vector<wvalue>{}));
1442  l->reserve(r.size());
1443  for(auto it = r.begin(); it != r.end(); ++it)
1444  l->emplace_back(*it);
1445  return;
1446  case type::Object:
1447  o = std::move(
1448  std::unique_ptr<
1449  std::unordered_map<std::string, wvalue>
1450  >(
1451  new std::unordered_map<std::string, wvalue>{}));
1452  for(auto it = r.begin(); it != r.end(); ++it)
1453  o->emplace(it->key(), *it);
1454  return;
1455  }
1456  }
1457 
1458  wvalue(wvalue&& r)
1459  {
1460  *this = std::move(r);
1461  }
1462 
1463  wvalue& operator = (wvalue&& r)
1464  {
1465  t_ = r.t_;
1466  d = r.d;
1467  s = std::move(r.s);
1468  l = std::move(r.l);
1469  o = std::move(r.o);
1470  return *this;
1471  }
1472 
1473  void clear()
1474  {
1475  t_ = type::Null;
1476  l.reset();
1477  o.reset();
1478  }
1479 
1480  void reset()
1481  {
1482  t_ = type::Null;
1483  l.reset();
1484  o.reset();
1485  }
1486 
1487  wvalue& operator = (std::nullptr_t)
1488  {
1489  reset();
1490  return *this;
1491  }
1492  wvalue& operator = (bool value)
1493  {
1494  reset();
1495  if (value)
1496  t_ = type::True;
1497  else
1498  t_ = type::False;
1499  return *this;
1500  }
1501 
1502  wvalue& operator = (double value)
1503  {
1504  reset();
1505  t_ = type::Number;
1506  d = value;
1507  return *this;
1508  }
1509 
1510  wvalue& operator = (unsigned short value)
1511  {
1512  reset();
1513  t_ = type::Number;
1514  d = (double)value;
1515  return *this;
1516  }
1517 
1518  wvalue& operator = (short value)
1519  {
1520  reset();
1521  t_ = type::Number;
1522  d = (double)value;
1523  return *this;
1524  }
1525 
1526  wvalue& operator = (long long value)
1527  {
1528  reset();
1529  t_ = type::Number;
1530  d = (double)value;
1531  return *this;
1532  }
1533 
1534  wvalue& operator = (long value)
1535  {
1536  reset();
1537  t_ = type::Number;
1538  d = (double)value;
1539  return *this;
1540  }
1541 
1542  wvalue& operator = (int value)
1543  {
1544  reset();
1545  t_ = type::Number;
1546  d = (double)value;
1547  return *this;
1548  }
1549 
1550  wvalue& operator = (unsigned long long value)
1551  {
1552  reset();
1553  t_ = type::Number;
1554  d = (double)value;
1555  return *this;
1556  }
1557 
1558  wvalue& operator = (unsigned long value)
1559  {
1560  reset();
1561  t_ = type::Number;
1562  d = (double)value;
1563  return *this;
1564  }
1565 
1566  wvalue& operator = (unsigned int value)
1567  {
1568  reset();
1569  t_ = type::Number;
1570  d = (double)value;
1571  return *this;
1572  }
1573 
1574  wvalue& operator=(const char* str)
1575  {
1576  reset();
1577  t_ = type::String;
1578  s = str;
1579  return *this;
1580  }
1581 
1582  wvalue& operator=(const std::string& str)
1583  {
1584  reset();
1585  t_ = type::String;
1586  s = str;
1587  return *this;
1588  }
1589 
1590  template <typename T>
1591  wvalue& operator=(const std::vector<T>& v)
1592  {
1593  if (t_ != type::List)
1594  reset();
1595  t_ = type::List;
1596  if (!l)
1597  l = std::move(std::unique_ptr<std::vector<wvalue>>(new std::vector<wvalue>{}));
1598  l->clear();
1599  l->resize(v.size());
1600  size_t idx = 0;
1601  for(auto& x:v)
1602  {
1603  (*l)[idx++] = x;
1604  }
1605  return *this;
1606  }
1607 
1608  wvalue& operator[](unsigned index)
1609  {
1610  if (t_ != type::List)
1611  reset();
1612  t_ = type::List;
1613  if (!l)
1614  l = std::move(std::unique_ptr<std::vector<wvalue>>(new std::vector<wvalue>{}));
1615  if (l->size() < index+1)
1616  l->resize(index+1);
1617  return (*l)[index];
1618  }
1619 
1620  int count(const std::string& str)
1621  {
1622  if (t_ != type::Object)
1623  return 0;
1624  if (!o)
1625  return 0;
1626  return o->count(str);
1627  }
1628 
1629  wvalue& operator[](const std::string& str)
1630  {
1631  if (t_ != type::Object)
1632  reset();
1633  t_ = type::Object;
1634  if (!o)
1635  o = std::move(
1636  std::unique_ptr<
1637  std::unordered_map<std::string, wvalue>
1638  >(
1639  new std::unordered_map<std::string, wvalue>{}));
1640  return (*o)[str];
1641  }
1642 
1643  size_t estimate_length() const
1644  {
1645  switch(t_)
1646  {
1647  case type::Null: return 4;
1648  case type::False: return 5;
1649  case type::True: return 4;
1650  case type::Number: return 30;
1651  case type::String: return 2+s.size()+s.size()/2;
1652  case type::List:
1653  {
1654  size_t sum{};
1655  if (l)
1656  {
1657  for(auto& x:*l)
1658  {
1659  sum += 1;
1660  sum += x.estimate_length();
1661  }
1662  }
1663  return sum+2;
1664  }
1665  case type::Object:
1666  {
1667  size_t sum{};
1668  if (o)
1669  {
1670  for(auto& kv:*o)
1671  {
1672  sum += 2;
1673  sum += 2+kv.first.size()+kv.first.size()/2;
1674  sum += kv.second.estimate_length();
1675  }
1676  }
1677  return sum+2;
1678  }
1679  }
1680  return 1;
1681  }
1682 
1683 
1684  friend void dump_internal(const wvalue& v, std::string& out);
1685  friend std::string dump(const wvalue& v);
1686  };
1687 
1688  inline void dump_string(const std::string& str, std::string& out)
1689  {
1690  out.push_back('"');
1691  escape(str, out);
1692  out.push_back('"');
1693  }
1694  inline void dump_internal(const wvalue& v, std::string& out)
1695  {
1696  switch(v.t_)
1697  {
1698  case type::Null: out += "null"; break;
1699  case type::False: out += "false"; break;
1700  case type::True: out += "true"; break;
1701  case type::Number:
1702  {
1703  char outbuf[128];
1704  sprintf(outbuf, "%g", v.d);
1705  out += outbuf;
1706  }
1707  break;
1708  case type::String: dump_string(v.s, out); break;
1709  case type::List:
1710  {
1711  out.push_back('[');
1712  if (v.l)
1713  {
1714  bool first = true;
1715  for(auto& x:*v.l)
1716  {
1717  if (!first)
1718  {
1719  out.push_back(',');
1720  }
1721  first = false;
1722  dump_internal(x, out);
1723  }
1724  }
1725  out.push_back(']');
1726  }
1727  break;
1728  case type::Object:
1729  {
1730  out.push_back('{');
1731  if (v.o)
1732  {
1733  bool first = true;
1734  for(auto& kv:*v.o)
1735  {
1736  if (!first)
1737  {
1738  out.push_back(',');
1739  }
1740  first = false;
1741  dump_string(kv.first, out);
1742  out.push_back(':');
1743  dump_internal(kv.second, out);
1744  }
1745  }
1746  out.push_back('}');
1747  }
1748  break;
1749  }
1750  }
1751 
1752  inline std::string dump(const wvalue& v)
1753  {
1754  std::string ret;
1755  ret.reserve(v.estimate_length());
1756  dump_internal(v, ret);
1757  return ret;
1758  }
1759 
1760  //std::vector<boost::asio::const_buffer> dump_ref(wvalue& v)
1761  //{
1762  //}
1763  }
1764 }
1765 
1766 #undef crow_json_likely
1767 #undef crow_json_unlikely
1768 
1769 
1770 
1771 #pragma once
1772 #include <string>
1773 #include <vector>
1774 #include <fstream>
1775 #include <iterator>
1776 #include <functional>
1777 
1778 
1779 namespace crow
1780 {
1781  namespace mustache
1782  {
1783  using context = json::wvalue;
1784 
1785  template_t load(const std::string& filename);
1786 
1787  class invalid_template_exception : public std::exception
1788  {
1789  public:
1790  invalid_template_exception(const std::string& msg)
1791  : msg("crow::mustache error: " + msg)
1792  {
1793  }
1794  virtual const char* what() const throw()
1795  {
1796  return msg.c_str();
1797  }
1798  std::string msg;
1799  };
1800 
1801  enum class ActionType
1802  {
1803  Ignore,
1804  Tag,
1805  UnescapeTag,
1806  OpenBlock,
1807  CloseBlock,
1808  ElseBlock,
1809  Partial,
1810  };
1811 
1812  struct Action
1813  {
1814  int start;
1815  int end;
1816  int pos;
1817  ActionType t;
1818  Action(ActionType t, int start, int end, int pos = 0)
1819  : start(start), end(end), pos(pos), t(t)
1820  {}
1821  };
1822 
1823  class template_t
1824  {
1825  public:
1826  template_t(std::string body)
1827  : body_(std::move(body))
1828  {
1829  // {{ {{# {{/ {{^ {{! {{> {{=
1830  parse();
1831  }
1832 
1833  private:
1834  std::string tag_name(const Action& action)
1835  {
1836  return body_.substr(action.start, action.end - action.start);
1837  }
1838  auto find_context(const std::string& name, const std::vector<context*>& stack)->std::pair<bool, context&>
1839  {
1840  if (name == ".")
1841  {
1842  return {true, *stack.back()};
1843  }
1844  int dotPosition = name.find(".");
1845  if (dotPosition == (int)name.npos)
1846  {
1847  for(auto it = stack.rbegin(); it != stack.rend(); ++it)
1848  {
1849  if ((*it)->t() == json::type::Object)
1850  {
1851  if ((*it)->count(name))
1852  return {true, (**it)[name]};
1853  }
1854  }
1855  }
1856  else
1857  {
1858  std::vector<int> dotPositions;
1859  dotPositions.push_back(-1);
1860  while(dotPosition != (int)name.npos)
1861  {
1862  dotPositions.push_back(dotPosition);
1863  dotPosition = name.find(".", dotPosition+1);
1864  }
1865  dotPositions.push_back(name.size());
1866  std::vector<std::string> names;
1867  names.reserve(dotPositions.size()-1);
1868  for(int i = 1; i < (int)dotPositions.size(); i ++)
1869  names.emplace_back(name.substr(dotPositions[i-1]+1, dotPositions[i]-dotPositions[i-1]-1));
1870 
1871  for(auto it = stack.rbegin(); it != stack.rend(); ++it)
1872  {
1873  context* view = *it;
1874  bool found = true;
1875  for(auto jt = names.begin(); jt != names.end(); ++jt)
1876  {
1877  if (view->t() == json::type::Object &&
1878  view->count(*jt))
1879  {
1880  view = &(*view)[*jt];
1881  }
1882  else
1883  {
1884  found = false;
1885  break;
1886  }
1887  }
1888  if (found)
1889  return {true, *view};
1890  }
1891 
1892  }
1893 
1894  static json::wvalue empty_str;
1895  empty_str = "";
1896  return {false, empty_str};
1897  }
1898 
1899  void escape(const std::string& in, std::string& out)
1900  {
1901  out.reserve(out.size() + in.size());
1902  for(auto it = in.begin(); it != in.end(); ++it)
1903  {
1904  switch(*it)
1905  {
1906  case '&': out += "&amp;"; break;
1907  case '<': out += "&lt;"; break;
1908  case '>': out += "&gt;"; break;
1909  case '"': out += "&quot;"; break;
1910  case '\'': out += "&#39;"; break;
1911  case '/': out += "&#x2F;"; break;
1912  default: out += *it; break;
1913  }
1914  }
1915  }
1916 
1917  void render_internal(int actionBegin, int actionEnd, std::vector<context*>& stack, std::string& out, int indent)
1918  {
1919  int current = actionBegin;
1920 
1921  if (indent)
1922  out.insert(out.size(), indent, ' ');
1923 
1924  while(current < actionEnd)
1925  {
1926  auto& fragment = fragments_[current];
1927  auto& action = actions_[current];
1928  render_fragment(fragment, indent, out);
1929  switch(action.t)
1930  {
1931  case ActionType::Ignore:
1932  // do nothing
1933  break;
1934  case ActionType::Partial:
1935  {
1936  std::string partial_name = tag_name(action);
1937  auto partial_templ = load(partial_name);
1938  int partial_indent = action.pos;
1939  partial_templ.render_internal(0, partial_templ.fragments_.size()-1, stack, out, partial_indent?indent+partial_indent:0);
1940  }
1941  break;
1942  case ActionType::UnescapeTag:
1943  case ActionType::Tag:
1944  {
1945  auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack);
1946  auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
1947  switch(ctx.t())
1948  {
1949  case json::type::Number:
1950  out += json::dump(ctx);
1951  break;
1952  case json::type::String:
1953  if (action.t == ActionType::Tag)
1954  escape(ctx.s, out);
1955  else
1956  out += ctx.s;
1957  break;
1958  default:
1959  throw std::runtime_error("not implemented tag type" + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>((int)ctx.t()));
1960  }
1961  }
1962  break;
1963  case ActionType::ElseBlock:
1964  {
1965  static context nullContext;
1966  auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack);
1967  if (!optional_ctx.first)
1968  {
1969  stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
1970  break;
1971  }
1972 
1973  auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
1974  switch(ctx.t())
1975  {
1976  case json::type::List:
1977  if (ctx.l && !ctx.l->empty())
1978  current = action.pos;
1979  else
1980  stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
1981  break;
1982  case json::type::False:
1983  case json::type::Null:
1984  stack.emplace_back(&nullContext);
1985  break;
1986  default:
1987  current = action.pos;
1988  break;
1989  }
1990  break;
1991  }
1992  case ActionType::OpenBlock:
1993  {
1994  auto optional_ctx = find_context(tag_name(action), stack);
1995  if (!optional_ctx.first)
1996  {
1997  current = action.pos;
1998  break;
1999  }
2000 
2001  auto& ctx = optional_ctx.second;
2002  switch(ctx.t())
2003  {
2004  case json::type::List:
2005  if (ctx.l)
2006  for(auto it = ctx.l->begin(); it != ctx.l->end(); ++it)
2007  {
2008  stack.push_back(&*it);
2009  render_internal(current+1, action.pos, stack, out, indent);
2010  stack.pop_back();
2011  }
2012  current = action.pos;
2013  break;
2014  case json::type::Number:
2015  case json::type::String:
2016  case json::type::Object:
2017  case json::type::True:
2018  stack.push_back(&ctx);
2019  break;
2020  case json::type::False:
2021  case json::type::Null:
2022  current = action.pos;
2023  break;
2024  default:
2025  throw std::runtime_error("{{#: not implemented context type: " + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>((int)ctx.t()));
2026  break;
2027  }
2028  break;
2029  }
2030  case ActionType::CloseBlock:
2031  stack.pop_back();
2032  break;
2033  default:
2034  throw std::runtime_error("not implemented " + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>((int)action.t));
2035  }
2036  current++;
2037  }
2038  auto& fragment = fragments_[actionEnd];
2039  render_fragment(fragment, indent, out);
2040  }
2041  void render_fragment(const std::pair<int, int> fragment, int indent, std::string& out)
2042  {
2043  if (indent)
2044  {
2045  for(int i = fragment.first; i < fragment.second; i ++)
2046  {
2047  out += body_[i];
2048  if (body_[i] == '\n' && i+1 != (int)body_.size())
2049  out.insert(out.size(), indent, ' ');
2050  }
2051  }
2052  else
2053  out.insert(out.size(), body_, fragment.first, fragment.second-fragment.first);
2054  }
2055  public:
2056  std::string render()
2057  {
2058  context empty_ctx;
2059  std::vector<context*> stack;
2060  stack.emplace_back(&empty_ctx);
2061 
2062  std::string ret;
2063  render_internal(0, fragments_.size()-1, stack, ret, 0);
2064  return ret;
2065  }
2066  std::string render(context& ctx)
2067  {
2068  std::vector<context*> stack;
2069  stack.emplace_back(&ctx);
2070 
2071  std::string ret;
2072  render_internal(0, fragments_.size()-1, stack, ret, 0);
2073  return ret;
2074  }
2075 
2076  private:
2077 
2078  void parse()
2079  {
2080  std::string tag_open = "{{";
2081  std::string tag_close = "}}";
2082 
2083  std::vector<int> blockPositions;
2084 
2085  size_t current = 0;
2086  while(1)
2087  {
2088  size_t idx = body_.find(tag_open, current);
2089  if (idx == body_.npos)
2090  {
2091  fragments_.emplace_back(current, body_.size());
2092  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::Ignore, 0, 0);
2093  break;
2094  }
2095  fragments_.emplace_back(current, idx);
2096 
2097  idx += tag_open.size();
2098  size_t endIdx = body_.find(tag_close, idx);
2099  if (endIdx == idx)
2100  {
2101  throw invalid_template_exception("empty tag is not allowed");
2102  }
2103  if (endIdx == body_.npos)
2104  {
2105  // error, no matching tag
2106  throw invalid_template_exception("not matched opening tag");
2107  }
2108  current = endIdx + tag_close.size();
2109  switch(body_[idx])
2110  {
2111  case '#':
2112  idx++;
2113  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2114  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2115  blockPositions.emplace_back(actions_.size());
2116  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::OpenBlock, idx, endIdx);
2117  break;
2118  case '/':
2119  idx++;
2120  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2121  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2122  {
2123  auto& matched = actions_[blockPositions.back()];
2124  if (body_.compare(idx, endIdx-idx,
2125  body_, matched.start, matched.end - matched.start) != 0)
2126  {
2127  throw invalid_template_exception("not matched {{# {{/ pair: " +
2128  body_.substr(matched.start, matched.end - matched.start) + ", " +
2129  body_.substr(idx, endIdx-idx));
2130  }
2131  matched.pos = actions_.size();
2132  }
2133  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::CloseBlock, idx, endIdx, blockPositions.back());
2134  blockPositions.pop_back();
2135  break;
2136  case '^':
2137  idx++;
2138  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2139  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2140  blockPositions.emplace_back(actions_.size());
2141  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::ElseBlock, idx, endIdx);
2142  break;
2143  case '!':
2144  // do nothing action
2145  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::Ignore, idx+1, endIdx);
2146  break;
2147  case '>': // partial
2148  idx++;
2149  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2150  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2151  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::Partial, idx, endIdx);
2152  break;
2153  case '{':
2154  if (tag_open != "{{" || tag_close != "}}")
2155  throw invalid_template_exception("cannot use triple mustache when delimiter changed");
2156 
2157  idx ++;
2158  if (body_[endIdx+2] != '}')
2159  {
2160  throw invalid_template_exception("{{{: }}} not matched");
2161  }
2162  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2163  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2164  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::UnescapeTag, idx, endIdx);
2165  current++;
2166  break;
2167  case '&':
2168  idx ++;
2169  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2170  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2171  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::UnescapeTag, idx, endIdx);
2172  break;
2173  case '=':
2174  // tag itself is no-op
2175  idx ++;
2176  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::Ignore, idx, endIdx);
2177  endIdx --;
2178  if (body_[endIdx] != '=')
2179  throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: not matching = tag: "+body_.substr(idx, endIdx-idx));
2180  endIdx --;
2181  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2182  while(body_[endIdx] == ' ') endIdx--;
2183  endIdx++;
2184  {
2185  bool succeeded = false;
2186  for(size_t i = idx; i < endIdx; i++)
2187  {
2188  if (body_[i] == ' ')
2189  {
2190  tag_open = body_.substr(idx, i-idx);
2191  while(body_[i] == ' ') i++;
2192  tag_close = body_.substr(i, endIdx-i);
2193  if (tag_open.empty())
2194  throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: empty open tag");
2195  if (tag_close.empty())
2196  throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: empty close tag");
2197 
2198  if (tag_close.find(" ") != tag_close.npos)
2199  throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: invalid open/close tag: "+tag_open+" " + tag_close);
2200  succeeded = true;
2201  break;
2202  }
2203  }
2204  if (!succeeded)
2205  throw invalid_template_exception("{{=: cannot find space between new open/close tags");
2206  }
2207  break;
2208  default:
2209  // normal tag case;
2210  while(body_[idx] == ' ') idx++;
2211  while(body_[endIdx-1] == ' ') endIdx--;
2212  actions_.emplace_back(ActionType::Tag, idx, endIdx);
2213  break;
2214  }
2215  }
2216 
2217  // removing standalones
2218  for(int i = actions_.size()-2; i >= 0; i --)
2219  {
2220  if (actions_[i].t == ActionType::Tag || actions_[i].t == ActionType::UnescapeTag)
2221  continue;
2222  auto& fragment_before = fragments_[i];
2223  auto& fragment_after = fragments_[i+1];
2224  bool is_last_action = i == (int)actions_.size()-2;
2225  bool all_space_before = true;
2226  int j, k;
2227  for(j = fragment_before.second-1;j >= fragment_before.first;j--)
2228  {
2229  if (body_[j] != ' ')
2230  {
2231  all_space_before = false;
2232  break;
2233  }
2234  }
2235  if (all_space_before && i > 0)
2236  continue;
2237  if (!all_space_before && body_[j] != '\n')
2238  continue;
2239  bool all_space_after = true;
2240  for(k = fragment_after.first; k < (int)body_.size() && k < fragment_after.second; k ++)
2241  {
2242  if (body_[k] != ' ')
2243  {
2244  all_space_after = false;
2245  break;
2246  }
2247  }
2248  if (all_space_after && !is_last_action)
2249  continue;
2250  if (!all_space_after &&
2251  !(
2252  body_[k] == '\n'
2253  ||
2254  (body_[k] == '\r' &&
2255  k + 1 < (int)body_.size() &&
2256  body_[k+1] == '\n')))
2257  continue;
2258  if (actions_[i].t == ActionType::Partial)
2259  {
2260  actions_[i].pos = fragment_before.second - j - 1;
2261  }
2262  fragment_before.second = j+1;
2263  if (!all_space_after)
2264  {
2265  if (body_[k] == '\n')
2266  k++;
2267  else
2268  k += 2;
2269  fragment_after.first = k;
2270  }
2271  }
2272  }
2273 
2274  std::vector<std::pair<int,int>> fragments_;
2275  std::vector<Action> actions_;
2276  std::string body_;
2277  };
2278 
2279  inline template_t compile(const std::string& body)
2280  {
2281  return template_t(body);
2282  }
2283  namespace detail
2284  {
2285  inline std::string& get_template_base_directory_ref()
2286  {
2287  static std::string template_base_directory = "templates";
2288  return template_base_directory;
2289  }
2290  }
2291 
2292  inline std::string default_loader(const std::string& filename)
2293  {
2294  std::ifstream inf(detail::get_template_base_directory_ref() + filename);
2295  if (!inf)
2296  return {};
2297  return {std::istreambuf_iterator<char>(inf), std::istreambuf_iterator<char>()};
2298  }
2299 
2300  namespace detail
2301  {
2302  inline std::function<std::string (std::string)>& get_loader_ref()
2303  {
2304  static std::function<std::string (std::string)> loader = default_loader;
2305  return loader;
2306  }
2307  }
2308 
2309  inline void set_base(const std::string& path)
2310  {
2311  auto& base = detail::get_template_base_directory_ref();
2312  base = path;
2313  if (base.back() != '\\' &&
2314  base.back() != '/')
2315  {
2316  base += '/';
2317  }
2318  }
2319 
2320  inline void set_loader(std::function<std::string(std::string)> loader)
2321  {
2322  detail::get_loader_ref() = std::move(loader);
2323  }
2324 
2325  inline template_t load(const std::string& filename)
2326  {
2327  return compile(detail::get_loader_ref()(filename));
2328  }
2329  }
2330 }
2331 
2332 
2333

2338  * of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to
2339  * deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the
2340  * rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or

2342  * furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

2345  * all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
